reviewText: Bedrock...Dogpatch...Springfield...Cidapolis...Townsville. TOWNSVILLE! What exactly is it that makes this rather unremarkable little cartoon village with a rather unremarkable name SO DARN REMARKABLE??? It's HOME to superpowered triplet sisters who are born and bred to protect such a vulnerable little pocket of utopian fantasyland from the jealous, greedy, and hateful clutches of the wackiest cartoon villains ever to be drawn on an animation cel!Our pee-ween sweethearts are so different from each other it's like successfully growing an apple, an orange, and a lemon on a single tree! But what they all have in common are their huge moon-like eyes, their cunning elfin appearance, their body-hugging elastic frocks complete with black karate belts, snow-white stockings, and such adorable black maryjanes that they are always tiptoeing around in like nimble little ballerinas!Donning her big, floppy red hairbow as a leader's headdress and wearing her pretty red hair so delicately caught up in a cute heart-shaped barette, Blossom is a very proud, vain, and maternal "older sister" despite the fact she's still the very same age as her other two sisters and quite prone to making childish mistakes as well!Bubbles's wide-eyed, pigtailed, and big-smiled appearance, her sunshine-and-daisies attitudes, and even her name to boot would BELIE her "hardcore" toughness that enables her to bring down a cycloctopus the size of the TALLEST Townsville skyscraper, so...perhaps you'd better retain yourself from telling "dumb blonde" jokes in front of HER!With a stern glint in her cat-green eyes underneath her shining jet-black bangs, Buttercup would send chilling shivers up and down even the meanest gangster's back merely by crossing her arms and glowering crossly with her eyebrows and lips permanently turned downwards. Yet this mischievous little terror is still as innocent, insecure, and lovable as any small child her age.Like any 'toondom in the whole world, Townsville is full of such an astonishing assortment of supporting characters like Professor Utonium, the patient "daddy" to the girls, Ms. Keane, the patient schoolmarm to the girls, Mayor the bumbling little monocle-covered midget who runs the city and his Batman-inspired hotline phone with its smiley face, and Ms. Sarah Bellum (say this name out loud and you'll get this little word gag!), the mayor's motherly secretary with a real knockout body and a whole fog of frizzy red hair that only hints that there's really INDEED a head up there!Oh, and please don't get me started on the whole lineup of villains! My gosh...there's an insane chimpazee, a trio of gutless human-sized cells, a devil-like being with crab-like claws and the most questionable tastes in costumes, a sickly-looking gang of teen punks with REALLY SERIOUS complexion problems, and all the other weirdos that you'd NEVER SEE in a sweet, bubblegum-pink Saturday-morning 'toon made specifically for sparkly-eyed little girls!Sure, the three tots are all in a nursery school right now, but...what if they are in JUNIOR HIGH SCHOOL??? Uh, better pack up and move right out of Townsville altogether - especially if you're a professional troublemaker or something!:)
summary: Maybe every town needs a few Powerpuff Girls???

reviewerName: Desired FX "Call me Don. It's shorter than Is...
reviewText: This is my least favorite of the first 3 PPG DVDs. The cartoons are first rate, and it was fun to see the two bonus cartoons before they aired on Cartoon Network, but some of the features that make the disc fun right out of the box become tedious when you just want to sit down and watch some cartoons.The first two PPG discs had a "play all" option, which simply played all 10 PPG cartoons on the disc with a single push of a button. On top of that, the discs defaulted to running in "play all" mode after sitting on the menu screen for about 2 minutes."The Mane Event" has a "play all" option, but it only plays the six cartoons accessible from the main menu--the bonus cartoons (and the two "commentary" 'toons) are not included in the sequence: the viewer has to navigate the menus whenever he wants to watch them.Now, the menus themselves are fun, no question (as where Mojo Jojo trudges across his laboratory grousing about slowpoke users not making menu selections), but the very things that excite and amuse you when you first begin to play with the DVD become monotonous when you just want to watch.Many of the bonus features you find in Virtual Townsville are great to watch, but don't stand up to repeated viewing. And as much as I loved watching episodes with comments from the Mayor and Mojo Jojo ("Hah hah! I knew it all along."), the cartoons stand better on their own.Obviously, I still love this disc, or I wouldn't have given it 5 stars. In addition, I was pleased to see such an ambitious package put together to present them--it shows that the people at Cartoon Network really care about their product and their viewers.
summary: Excessive navigation mars an otherwise perfect product.

reviewText: The Powerpuff Girls are so funny! The Mane Event will have you gasping for air. Bubbles and Buttercup are forced to slay a giant eye ball distroying Townsville alone. After their jealousy of how gorgeous Blossom's hair is in the morning causes them to give her the worst hair cut of her life. Now embarrassed to go out in public, will the girls beable to do it alone? This is a great dvd and I highly recommend it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The quality of the episodes included here varies widely. But the extra material included on the DVD makes up for that. Don't miss Craig McCracken presenting his original film school project that was the prototype for The Powerpuff Girls! I also enjoyed the show 'n tell segment: the Girls are their most engaging when they're just "being themselves".
summary: DVD Extras Make This Collection Worth a Look
Title: N/A

reviewText: What can I say about this DVD? The cartoons are a great selection, that's for sure. I liked seeing the two episodes that were never released on television, they were wonderful. I gave that five stars. But man, I wish I could give the DVD seven stars. The design blew my mine. It was definately the COOLEST most cheerful DVD I've ever come across. You start out on the main page. You can watch all cartoons, select a cartoon, select language, or adventure in Townsvill. I went straight to adventure in Townsville and I was having fun just looking over Townsville! You then click on a building (Pokie Oaks, Mojo JoJo's, Townsville broadcasting system, ETC) and the screen will close up into the building so you're inside. Each room has motion inside and sound and each room has different special features that you would expect to find in that specific room. Not only is the cartoon great but now it's Jam Packed with special features. I bought this for my little brother, but I love it more than he does!(He likes it too)
